name: Caboclo D'Água
description:
On the banks of the São Francisco River, boatmen and fishermen tell stories about the Caboclo d'Água, who lives at the bottom of the river and makes life miserable for those who make a living on the water.

Made of hard, impenetrable leather, it overturns boats, scares away fish, drowns bathers and takes their bodies away.

Legend has it that he inhabits a cave full of gold, a secret he fiercely guards. Everyone who tried to reach his cave never returned.

As protection, the boatmen of the São Francisco started to paint stars on the hulls of the boats or to use figureheads, monstrous sculptures placed on the bow to keep away the Caboclo d'Água and evil spirits. <Crypto Legends | A Series by Renancio Monte | 2021>
